alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 22 at 11:38AM CDT until August 22 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR DALLAS COUNTY... At 1138 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 10 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dallas, Garland, Irving, Grand Prairie, Mesquite, Carrollton, Richardson, Lewisville, Flower Mound, Rowlett, Desoto, Grapevine, Cedar Hill, Wylie, Coppell, Duncanville, Lancaster, Farmers Branch, Balch Springs and University Park. An additional 1.5 inches has fallen over the past hour. The heaviest rainfall has moved south of I-30, but widespread flooding issues are expected to continue. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
